variant.question: Consider a variable pitch propeller operating in a low RPM / high pitch condition. When feather is selected, the

options.text: condition lever (pitch control)is moved to the feather position and the blades move from high pitch directly to the feather position.
condition lever (pitch control)is moved to the feather position and the blades move from high pitch through low pitch to the feather position.
power lever is moved to the feather position and the blades move from low pitch through high pitch to the feather position.
power lever is moved to the feather position and the blades move from high pitch directly to the feather position.

variant.question: After start of a piston engine, correct operation of the pitch adjustment system of a constant speed propeller can be confirmed by altering the propeller control lever and checking indications on the

options.text: manifold pressure gauge.
engine oil pressure indicator.
exhaust gas temperature gauge.
tachometer.

variant.question: On an aeroplane equipped with a manual feathering system the pilot can feather the propeller by:

options.text: pushing the power lever forwards.
pulling the propeller control lever rearwards.
pulling the power levers rearwards.
pushing the propeller control lever forwards.

variant.question: When the pilot moves the mixture lever of a piston engine towards a leaner position the:

options.text: volume of air entering the carburettor is increased.
volume of air entering the carburettor is reduced.
amount of fuel entering the cylinders is reduced.
amount of fuel entering the cylinders is increased.

variant.question: Assuming the RPM and throttle levers are not altered, when TAS increases the blade angle of a constant speed propeller will..

options.text: increase.
decrease.
decrease, then after a short time increase to its previous value.
remain constant.

variant.question: The main advantage of a constant speed propeller compared to a fixed pitch propeller is that a constant speed propeller..

options.text: has a lower propeller blade stress.
does not require propeller blade twist.
has a higher maximum propeller efficiency.
maintains its maximum propeller efficiency over a wider range of airspeeds.

variant.question: Consider a variable pitch propeller operating in a high RPM / low pitch condition. To select reverse thrust, the

options.text: power lever is moved to the reverse position and the blades move from low pitch through high pitch to reverse pitch.
power lever is moved to the reverse position and the blades move from low pitch directly to reverse pitch.
condition lever is moved to the reverse position and the blades move from low pitch directly to reverse pitch.
condition lever is moved to the reverse position and the blades move from low pitch through high pitch to reverse pitch.

variant.question: For take-off, the correct combination of propeller pitch (1), and propeller lever position (2) for a piston engine at brake release is:

options.text: (1) high, (2) aft.
(1) high, (2) forward.
(1) low, (2) forward.
(1) low, (2) aft.
